data.title: Martin Lawrence: You So Crazy (1994)
data.meta_description: Stand up comedy by Martin Lawrence, filmed in the Majestic Theater in New York City. Martin Lawrence talks about everything from racism, to relationships, to his childhood.
data.text:
Quickie Review

Made between the height of his success on primetime television with his self-titled Fox sitcom and his success on the big screen a year later with Bad Boys, Martin Lawrence makes his way to the stand-up stage with the first of 2 theatrically released stand-up comedy concert films. Lawrence breaks free from the confines of network television and goes raw and uncut, riffing on everything from racism to women & relationships to his childhood to black people talking out in movies to drugs and more, all in one uncensored, unedited and uncontrollable 86-minute set. There’s a couple of jokes that miss the mark but the rest of the jokes are fall down, watery-eyed, laugh-till-you-need-a-drink-of-water funny. There’s even one particular…

FILMED AT BAM!!!! (I remember when this played theatrically and i never knew it was filmed in Brooklyn--it was also i think the first time that I could remember a filmed comedy set/special getting a theatrical release instead of you know being on HBO--i mean those Richard Pryor and Eddie Murphy ones were all slightly before my time being released in the 80s)

It's hard for me to judge a stand up comedy film because it always generally comes down to "did you laugh or not?" and the answer to that here is I chuckled sporadically, which is prob about par for the genre of stand up concert movies that I've seen thus far. There's some good material in here…
